intro: Lippia barbata, commonly known as hairy lippia, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Lippia barbata is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its potential aromatic and medicinal properties.
